item.title: One Elden Ring Nightreign Class Sticks Out Like a Sore Thumb
item.description:
Elden Ring Nightreign is a fascinating project for many reasons, not the least of which being its unique, rigid class structure. FromSoftware’s approach to traditional RPG classes in games like Dark Souls and Elden Ring has historically been far more fluid, with a player’s starting class being more like a suggestion or jumping-off point than a strict set of gameplay rules to adhere to.

This is not the case in Elden Ring Nightreign , which presents players with eight distinct character archetypes to choose from at the start of each run.

There’s some wiggle room in the form of various upgrades and collectible gear, which may steer an archetype’s path in a given playthrough, but the system is far more restrictive overall compared to other FromSoft RPGs. For instance, the Recluse character ( Nightreign ’s version of a sorcerer) can never wield a melee weapon, while the tank-like Guardian will never sling spells. Interestingly, each of these archetypes seems to adhere to already-existing Elden Ring classes and playstyles like spellcaster, ranger, and rogue, or otherwise seems inspired by the gameplay of Bloodborne and Sekiro , as appears to be the case with Duchess and Executor. But one Nightreign archetype, only recently announced, bucks this trend.

How Elden Ring Nightreign’s Revenant Archetype Stands Out from the Pack

Elden Ring Nightreign’s Revenant Appears To Be Purely Summons-Focused

Glimpsed in Nightreign ’s recent overview trailer and rumored to be called Revenant, this harp-wielding, doll-like combatant comes across as markedly distinct, seemingly only able to summon various Elden Ring Spirit Ashes for support on the battlefield. Using their harp, the Revenant ostensibly provides support to their teammates without ever joining fights directly, as their summoned spirits do their dirty work for them. With little more than a harp—magical or not—at their disposal, it’s easy to see why the Revenant would want to stay on the sidelines.

The word 'revenant' refers to someone who has returned from the dead, making it a fitting title for this eerie doll-like being that summons spiritual forces for assistance.

This is a rather interesting premise for a playable character, as it rejects the central game mechanics of typical FromSoftware games. Of course, summons are commonplace in FromSoft RPGs, especially in Elden Ring , thanks to Spirit Ashes, but they are almost never viable as a primary offensive tool, so incorporating a playable character designed specifically around the mechanic is a massive change. The Revenant seems unlikely to facilitate traditional Soulslike gameplay, but that’s what makes the class so interesting.

The Revenant’s Experimental Mechanics Highlight What Makes Elden Ring Nightreign Unique

Assuming that the Revenant is indeed a summons-only class, it could offer a significantly novel spin on Elden Ring ’s core gameplay formula. Before the revelation of this new class, Ironeye was arguably the most unique Elden Ring Nightreign archetype, as ranged-only builds are fairly hard to pull off in Elden Ring and Dark Souls . Ironeye’s distinctness pales in comparison to Revenant’s, as the latter essentially exists beyond the boundaries of standard Soulslike combat.

It’s also interesting to note that Revenant seems designed around one of the most contentious and oft-maligned Elden Ring gameplay systems. Many Elden Ring purists will bemoan the use of Spirit Ashes, arguing that such methods detract from the core gameplay loop.

This mentality is often criticized, and for good reason, but it will be interesting to see how much detractors view Spirit Ashes in the cooperative framework of Elden Ring Nightreign . After all, the spin-off is all about multiple heroes working together, and is overall a far cry from the lonesome gameplay of the base game, so mechanics like Spirit Ash summons may be radically recontextualized.

item.title: Destiny 2: Long Arm God Rolls Guide
item.description:
Long Arm is one of the most powerful Scout Rifles in Destiny 2, and with the renewed perk pool, this weapon, brought in Rite of the Nine, has become quite the powerhouse among long-range weapons. The weapon has also received a new trait, Gravity Well, which automatically gathers nearby ammo bricks whenever the weapon is recharged.

So, in this guide, players will learn all about the new and reprized Long Arm, including its God Rolls, available perks, and every detail about its traits.

Long Arm PvE God Roll In Destiny 2

  • The PvE God Roll for Long Arm includes Subsistence as the primary perk and Rolling Storm as the secondary perk.

Barrel

Arrowhead Brake

Magazine

Appended Mag

Perk 1

Subsistence (or Rapid Hit)

Perk 2

Rolling Storm (or Dragonfly)

Masterwork

Handling (or Reload)

Subsistence is a useful perk for PvE, since it will reload the magazine each time players kill enemies with this Scout Rifle. On the other hand, some players also choose Rapid Hit to create a similar effect to that of the Dead Man's Tale primary perk, increasing recharge speed upon landing precision hits. Rolling Storm is one of the newest perks added to the Long Arm pool, which creates stacks of Bolt Charge each time players kill an enemy. Since Bolt Charge is absolutely broken right now, this will guarantee a ton of damage against the most powerful enemies in Destiny 2.

Long Arm PvP God Roll In Destiny 2

  • The PvP God Roll for Long Arm includes Lone Wolf in the first column, and Explosive Payload as the second perk.

Barrel

Arrowhead Brake

Magazine

Steady Rounds

Perk 1

Lone Wolf (or Hip-Fire Grip)

Perk 2

Explosive Payload (or Precision Instrument)

Masterwork

Reload (or Stability)

Lone Wolf has been an incredible addition to the Long Arm perk pool, since it adds lots of aim assist and aiming speed, the more damage players cause, and if they're alone and taking down enemies from the side, away from their team. These benefits are increased. It is a great perk that really makes an honor to its name, ideal for those who prefer a less direct approach, taking enemies down from afar. Now, Explosive Payload is the perfect combination for this perk, making sure that every hit to the center-mass of enemy players deals lots of hurt. Precision Instrument is good as well, but only for those who are experts in landing headshot after headshot. At the end of the day, both perks are equally strong, but if players want more overall damage, they should stick to Explosive Payload.

How To Get Long Arm In Destiny 2

To get Long Arm Scout Rifle in Destiny 2, players need to complete Activities in the Spire of the Watcher Dungeon on the Rite of the Nine activity tab. It doesn't matter if players complete this activity in Explorer , Eternity , or Ultimatum , the weapon can drop from any of the chests in the Dungeon. More so if players Attune to the Long Arm in the Rite of the Nine event hub, and then exchange Nonary Manifolds at the Reward Chest, they're bound to get some drops of the Long Arm there.

It is also possible to get the Long Arm with Curated rolls , or its Adept version, or the Shiny version of both Curated and Adept Long Arm. The ideal version would be the Shiny Adept Long Arm Scout Rifle, which comes with up to 4 perks to choose from at any time (2 in each column). But that depends on the luck players have with the game's RNG system.

item.title: Cronos: The New Dawn May Suddenly Be a Big Game For Bloodborne Fans
item.description:
Cronos: The New Dawn is a brand-new IP from horror developer Bloober Team. Fresh off the success of its Silent Hill 2 remake and original games like Layers of Fear and Blair Witch , Bloober Team has proven itself as a horror powerhouse. Cronos: The New Dawn now has the tough task of meeting high expectations, but previews of the game appear both promising and spine-chilling.

One of the clearest sources of inspiration for Cronos: The New Dawn is the Dead Space franchise. From the oppressive atmosphere to the intense body horror, Cronos: The New Dawn is teasing a horrifying experience for players. According to a recent interview between TechRadar and game directors Wojciech Piejko and Jacek Zięba, Cronos: The New Dawn has a variety of inspirations, with one of the most exciting being Bloodborne .

Cronos: The New Dawn Could Be a Surprising Game to Help Scratch the Bloodborne Itch

  • Bloodborne launched for the PS4 on March 24, 2015.
  • Since then, hope of a sequel has continued to grow.
  • Developer FromSoftware currently has no known plans to make a second game.

Bloodborne is hailed by a lot of gamers and critics as one of the best games of all time. Over the years, rumors, leaks, and speculation regarding another Bloodborne game have continued to pile up with no confirmation or news proving such claims true. On the one hand, it's incredibly difficult to catch lightning in a bottle twice. However, on the other hand, fans have a lot of confidence in FromSoftware to do a sequel properly. Unfortunately, at this time, a Bloodborne sequel remains to be seen, but Cronos: The New Dawn may help satiate fans, at least partially.

The recently announced Switch 2 exclusive, The Duskbloods , is one of FromSoftware's next games and appears to have a healthy dose of Bloodborne inspiration.

Cronos: The New Dawn's Directors Reveal a Diverse List of Inspirations

Talking with TechRadar, Zięba mentioned that Cronos: The New Dawn has elements of " Death Stranding , even a little bit of Nier: Automata , Silent Hill, and, of course, Bloodborne in the city with the disease.” At the heart of Cronos: The New Dawn 's story lies a mysterious supernatural disease that causes the fictional city of the game to be put under martial law.

For Bloodborne fans, exploring a city ravaged by a plague that transforms its hosts into monsters sounds an awful lot like playing as the Hunter in Yharnam. Bloodborne is an incredibly unique story, and Bloober Team choosing to take inspiration for its own plague-infested narrative is bold and exciting.

From the oppressive atmosphere to the intense body horror, Cronos: The New Dawn is teasing a horrifying experience for players.

Cronos: The New Dawn Faces a Potentially Packed Year for Horror Games

  • Cronos: The New Dawn has yet to reveal an official release date, but its Steam page claims a 2025 target.

Cronos: The New Dawn isn't the only horror game that has yet to announce its release date. Fellow horror titles like Little Nightmares 3 , Dying Light: The Beast , Reanimal , and John Carpenter's Toxic Commando are also keeping quiet about launch targets. Assuming that the developers of these games want to take advantage of the month of October, the fall could be packed with a variety of fright-filled offerings. 2025 could be big for horror, but the wait for launch dates continues, as delays can also happen.

Upcoming horror title Directive 8020 has locked in a release date of October 2, 2025, being the first to stake its claim on the spooky season.

Based on what Bloober Team has showcased, though, it looks like Cronos: The New Dawn may be ready to launch soon, or at least stay on track for this year. Once the game finally arrives, it will be exciting to see just how much Bloodborne has actually influenced the atmosphere of Cronos: The New Dawn .

item.title: 8 Most Fun Grand Theft Auto Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Grand Theft Auto games revolutionized open-world gaming, emphasizing fun, freedom, and chaos.
  • Each game in the franchise offers unique experiences, missions, and characters that enhance the overall fun factor.
  • Grand Theft Auto Online remains a thriving multiplayer mode, packed with content and endless criminal opportunities.

Grand Theft Auto is one of the greatest video game franchises of all time, single-handedly turning Rockstar into one of the biggest studios in the industry. There's a reason why fans are eagerly awaiting the release of Grand Theft Auto 6 , with the impending debut already causing quite a bit of excitement.

Every game in the Grand Theft Auto series is a ton of fun to play and shows why players love the freeform nature of this sandbox. While some titles are bound to be more enjoyable than others, that should take nothing away from the fun factor each title brings to the table.

8 Grand Theft Auto 3

The First 3D GTA Game Sparked An Open-World Revolution

Grand Theft Auto 3
13
7.8 /10
Released
October 23, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto 3 set up the building blocks for something special and single-handedly turned open-world games into the most popular genre in the video game industry. Some missions can be frustrating in this game, but the overall fun factor is off the charts and was revolutionary back in the day.

Along with the classic gameplay loop of causing chaos and attracting police attention, players could initiate one of many missions, find fast cars to gallivant in, and complete odd jobs to earn a ton of cash. The sheer number of things to do in this game was mind-boggling and served as a taste of things to come in the franchise.

7 Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories

The PSP GTA Games Were A Lot Of Fun

Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories
7.3 /10
Released
October 25, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

The PSP's controls can be a bit tricky to get used to for a GTA game, but fans who put in the effort will have a blast playing Liberty City Stories . Rockstar had become more comfortable with this engine by this point and had improved their mission structure considerably, too.

This helped Liberty City Stories stand out as one of the best games on the PlayStation Portable. Unlike Claude, Tony Cipriani has a voice that helps his personality shine and enhances the fun that players experience as they witness a cinematic scene that sets the stage for yet another action-packed mission.

6 Grand Theft Auto: Vice City Stories

Players Will Jump At Any Excuse To Get Into This Game

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City Stories
7.0 /10
Released
October 31, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Vice City Stories is an obvious improvement over its portable predecessor, featuring improved water physics and a better targeting system. Given that violence in a Miami-inspired city requires both elements to be top-notch, it's easy to see why fans were impressed by what this game brought to the table.

The novelty of controlling Lance Vance's older brother was enough to convince most players to check this game out. As long as they adjust to the PSP's control scheme, Vice City Stories will prove to be one of the most fun portable gaming experiences fans can subject themselves to.

5 Grand Theft Auto: Vice City

The Stylish Vibes Of Vice City Are A Joy To Explore

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
19
9.6 /10
Released
October 29, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Violence
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is one of the most stylish games in the series, with the eponymous city bursting with character. The game is also clearly inspired by media like Scarface and Miami Vice to make the experience more cinematic and engaging than ever.

At the heart of this game is Tommy Vercetti, a gangster released from prison who makes a name for himself in Vice City against all odds. Completing a bevy of action-packed missions and acquiring properties is more engaging than it has any right to be, cementing Vice City as one of the best Grand Theft Auto games ever made.

4 Grand Theft Auto 4

Niko Bellic's Adventures Were Mind-Blowing Back In The Day

Grand Theft Auto 4
22
9.1 /10
Released
April 29, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto 4 's take on Liberty City is amazing and lets players have a great time as they explore this reimagining of New York. It helps that this game boasts one of the more serious and mature stories in the series, with Niko Bellic establishing himself as a great protagonist fans will love to go berserk with.

On the gameplay side, Grand Theft Auto 4 is a clear improvement in everything from driving physics to combat gameplay. Players love how this game balances realism and arcade gameplay to let them enjoy the best of both worlds. Along with this, the impressive close-combat system is a surprising highlight that fans will love to mess around with.

3 Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

The Game Has So Many Systems That Fans Will Never Get Bored

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
110
8.7 /10
Released
October 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Powered by

To this day, there's something about San Andreas that keeps fans coming back for more. The amazing cast of characters, a story full of betrayal & redemption, fun light RPG elements, and a massive world all combine to enhance this title's fun factor.

Players can genuinely lose themselves in this game as they improve CJ's skills and make him more competent than ever before. The simulation elements also enhance a player's fun, with CJ having to eat, work out, and perform other activities to sustain his body.

2 Grand Theft Auto 5

Oozes Style As Players Explore A Massive And Beautiful World

Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
127
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
127
8.9 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto 5 was a massive step forward for Rockstar and showed just how far this developer had come in a short span of time. Three protagonists and the biggest open world in a GTA game were just indications of the sheer chaos and fun players could enjoy in this sandbox.

Los Santos and its surroundings are jam-packed with detail and endless opportunities for players to go ballistic and commit every crime in existence. The missions are also more cinematic than ever before, especially when it comes to the amazing heists that show this game at its very best.

1 Grand Theft Auto Online

There's A Reason Why Players Can't Get Enough Of This Multiplayer Mode

Grand Theft Auto Online
48
9.1 /10
Released
October 1, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto Online is one of the biggest multiplayer titles that is still played devotedly by fans more than a decade after its launch. It helps that Rockstar released a ridiculous amount of content in this mode, to the point where players can easily lose hundreds of hours living out their virtual life of crime in Los Santos.

From player-created races to the many multiplayer heists in this title, it's easy to see why Grand Theft Auto Online enjoys such a massive player base. Even if single-player fans may hate Rockstar's reliance on this money-making machine, they can't deny that this online mode is feature-rich and full of endless opportunities for players to have a ton of fun.

item.title: Animal Crossing is Long Overdue the Mario Treatment
item.description:
The first Animal Crossing game launched in Japan in April 2001, meaning the franchise recently passed its 24th anniversary. As Nintendo’s sixth best-selling IP, the animal-centric simulation series doesn’t seem to be going anywhere anytime soon. Furthermore, while there’s no word on when the next Animal Crossing game will be released, it’s certain to attract plenty of attention, particularly after the massive success of Animal Crossing: New Horizons in 2020.

In contrast, the Mario franchise debuted twenty years before Animal Crossing , beginning with Donkey Kong in 1981. Despite Mario reigning supreme as Nintendo's most successful franchise for over 40 years, this doesn't mean Animal Crossing can't receive the same level of care and support. In particular, it's time that Nintendo gave its adorable social simulation series the same treatment as Mario and expanded into different genres via unique spin-offs.

Nintendo Has a Major Opportunity to Seize with Animal Crossing

Mario's Video Game Presence Throughout the Years

Over the years, the Mario franchise has delivered hundreds of titles, including spin-offs like Mario Party , Mario Kart , Paper Mario , sports games, educational titles, and mobile games. Featuring two of gaming's most recognizable faces, the Mario franchise has sold over 900 million units as of June 2024, according to the Video Game Sales wiki. Mario himself has appeared in over 250 games of various genres.

Given how consistently successful Nintendo’s focus on Mario has been, giving Animal Crossing the same level of attention could be beneficial. Counting mainline entries, mobile games, and DLC, Animal Crossing has fewer than ten entries to its name. The list is as follows:

  1. Animal Crossing (2001)
  2. Animal Crossing: Wild World (2005)
  3. Animal Crossing: City Folk (2008)
  4. Animal Crossing: New Leaf (2012)
  5. Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer (2015)
  6. Animal Crossing: Amiibo Festival (2015)
  7. Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp (2017)
  8. Animal Crossing: New Horizons (2020)
  9. Animal Crossing: New Horizons – Happy Home Paradise (2021)

Why Now Is the Perfect Time to Diversify the Animal Crossing Series

Rumors have continued to spread about a new installment of Animal Crossing , and with the Switch 2 releasing on June 5, 2025, the perfect time for Nintendo to expand the series into new directions is approaching. While there's speculation that a new simulation game could arrive on the Switch 2 down the line, Nintendo has yet to confirm whether a follow-up to Animal Crossing: New Horizons is in development. Regardless, fans would likely be thrilled to see the series return in any capacity, especially if it’s a bold attempt to branch into new genres.

It's worth noting that several Animal Crossing characters have already been featured in other Nintendo franchises, like Mario Kart and Super Smash Bros . While spin-offs for the franchise have been limited, Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp offered a free-to-play mobile adaptation where players could manage a campsite, befriend animal characters, and customize their surroundings. Despite its unique charm and loyal community, Pocket Camp concluded its service in November 2024 after seven years.

If Animal Crossing were to delve into other genres, games featuring its beloved cast of characters like Tom Nook, Isabelle, and Brewster would likely capture much interest. It's possinle to envision party games like Mario Party , 3D platformers like Super Mario Odyssey , action-adventure titles like The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom , and sports games like Mario Tennis Aces . Given Animal Crossing 's family-friendly nature, recognizable characters, and distinctive art style, it seems overdue the Mario treatment where bold spin-offs help fill the gaps between traditional mainline releases.

10 Images
